author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: â€‹Eugenie Bouchardâ€™s Super Bowl tweet backfires; to go on a date with a Patriots fanâ€‹
text:
NEW DELHI: Canadian tennis player Eugenie Bouchard was so confident that Atlanta Falcons would go on to win the Super Bowl after going 25 points clear of New England Patriots at the end of third quarter that, she agreed to go on a date with a Patriots fan if they managed win from the impossible situation. And as luck would have it, inspired by Tom Brady , Patriots mounted the most stunning comeback in the NFL 's history winning 34-28 in overtime. And Bouchard, well she would learn a lesson not to bet against the now 5-time Super Bowl winner Brady.
It all started with a premature tweet from Bouchard claiming that she knew Falcons would win, even while the game was on.
I knew Atlanta would win btw
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017
But one of her 996k followers, @punslayintwoods, took the chance to bet against Falcons and asked Bouchard for a date if Patriots won.
@geniebouchard if patriots win we go on a date?
â€” TW1 (@punslayintwoods) February 6, 2017
Bouchard casually replied 'Sure', probably thinking that there no chance Flacons could blow this up. As Patriots mounted the comeback the 22-year-old started getting nervous:
Omfg
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017
And finally when Falcons blew it, Bouchard had lost the bet and @punslayintwoods had got himself a date with the Tennis star. Bouchard was sporting enough ask were the person lived but sent out a tweet saying she learned the lesson that never bet against Brady.
So...where do you live? https://t.co/mfucQ0C9VL
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017
Lesson learned. Never bet against Tom Brady ðŸ˜‡
â€” Genie Bouchard (@geniebouchard) February 6, 2017
